headline: Medtronic receives Type 2 label expansion for MiniMed 780G in Europe
summary: The CE mark also allows Medtronic’s automated insulin delivery system to be used during pregnancy and by children as young as two.

raw.headline: Medtronic receives Type 2 label expansion for MiniMed 780G in Europe
raw.summary: The CE mark also allows Medtronic’s automated insulin delivery system to be used during pregnancy and by children as young as two.

headline: Insulin Pumps Market Outlook Report 2025, with Leading Player Profiles for Medtronic, Insulet, Tandem Diabetes Care, and More
summary: The global insulin pump market, valued at USD 4.31 billion in 2024, is projected to soar to USD 7.27 billion by 2030 with a CAGR of 9.10% due to rising diabetes cases and technological advances. In 2024, insulin pumps held over 65% market share, with Type 1 diabetes driving growth at a 9.31% CAGR. North America dominates, capturing over 38% of the market share, while APAC is set for the fastest growth. Key factors include the adoption of automated insulin delivery systems and surging product app

headline: Want Decades of Passive Income? 3 Stocks to Buy Now and Hold Forever
summary: Medtronic is closing in on Dividend King status and has a historically high yield.  Becton, Dickinson is already a Dividend King and has a relatively high yield.  Universal Health has a huge yield and a four-decade dividend streak going.

raw.headline: Want Decades of Passive Income? 3 Stocks to Buy Now and Hold Forever

headline: Boston Scientific lifts annual profit view on steady heart devices demand
summary: Boston Scientific raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, after strong demand for its heart devices helped the U.S. medical device maker beat second-quarter profit estimates. Shares of the Massachusetts-based company rose 2.3% in premarket trading following the results. A rise in surgical procedures has benefited medical device manufacturers such as Boston Scientific, as it boosted sales and helped offset broader concerns about healthcare spending pressures.
